common_issues.title: Pieces OS Crashes and Integration Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS crashes, particularly on Windows, often linked to the native_extensions_plugin.dll.  Suggested workarounds include reinstalling the program, disabling antivirus/firewall, and updating graphics drivers.  Additionally, users experience difficulties downloading local LLMs on Linux and linking multiple cloud accounts (Google and GitHub) simultaneously across different OS versions.

related_issues.title: Crash due to native_extensions_plugin.dll
related_issues.text:
Crash due to native_extensions_plugin.dll
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS crashes. I’ve reinstalled the program, turned off the antivirus and firewall, updated the graphics driver, but nothing helps, it crashes consistently.
Windows 10, 64 bit, i3-12100F, RAM: 32 Gb, GTX 950.
If there's no solution, how can I disable this plugin so that it simply doesn't crash?

Here are the debug details:

rcx=0000000000000000

related_issues.title: Download of local LLM's initializes, but never proceeds
related_issues.text:
Download of local LLM's initializes, but never proceeds 
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS, VS Code

### Operating System

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

8.0.1

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I was trying to download a local LLM, but any one of them that I try it is stuck on initialising. It does not start downloading the model. I have tried downloading all the available models, but it does not move further than initialising. I have seen a similar issue on GitHub for somebody using windows, but for them, it went away after updating to version 8.0.0. of pieces OS. This is their GitHub issue https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/84 I am already on 8.0.1 but on Linux. I am pretty sure my internet is not an issue. The rest of the app functions perfectly. It's just that I cannot download local LLMs. I have also tried to install local LLMs through VS Code, but there instead of getting stuck on initializing it gets stuck on 0% complete.

I am on Linux
pieces OS : 8.0.1
pieces for developers : 2.10.0
OS : Ubuntu 22.04 LTS
CPU: Ryzen 5800H
Ram: 16gb
GPU: RTX 3050 mobile (4gbvram)

![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/106009563/a0d2900b-276a-4450-a0f4-100e1f8391d7)
![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/106009563/32fc5059-a497-4b5f-9be7-e498cd56329c)

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Issues with Local LLMs and Account Linking
common_issues.description: Users report persistent issues with the Pieces Desktop app, including difficulties linking multiple accounts (Google and GitHub) simultaneously and problems downloading or canceling local LLM downloads.  Account linking issues involve one account being unlinked when another is added, despite troubleshooting and support interaction.  Local LLM download problems manifest as downloads getting stuck on initializing or 0%, affecting Windows and Linux users.  Some users have attempted workarounds like disabling email privacy settings or updating the app, but the issues persist.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.

### Software

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I was trying to download a local LLM, but any one of them that I try it is stuck on initialising. It does not start downloading the model. I have tried downloading all the available models, but it does not move further than initialising. I have seen a similar issue on GitHub for somebody using windows, but for them, it went away after updating to version 8.0.0. of pieces OS. This is their GitHub issue https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/84 I am already on 8.0.1 but on Linux. I am pretty sure my internet is not an issue. The rest of the app functions perfectly. It's just that I cannot download local LLMs. I have also tried to install local LLMs through VS Code, but there instead of getting stuck on initializing it gets stuck on 0% complete.

I am on Linux

latest

### Early Access Program

i want stop but its not working

recommendations: Investigate and address the root cause of crashes related to 'native_extensions_plugin.dll' on Windows, prioritizing based on frequency and user impact.
Implement a robust solution for linking multiple cloud accounts (Google and GitHub) simultaneously in the Pieces Desktop app, ensuring consistent functionality across different OS versions.
Diagnose and fix the issue preventing local LLM downloads from progressing beyond initialization or 0% on both Windows and Linux platforms.
Improve the cancellation process for local LLM downloads to provide users with more control and prevent unnecessary resource consumption.
Enhance communication with users experiencing account linking and LLM download issues, providing clear updates and workarounds while a permanent fix is being developed.
Collect more detailed logs and diagnostics for crashes and download issues to facilitate faster troubleshooting and resolution.
Consider implementing automated tests to identify and prevent similar issues in future releases.
Review and update documentation related to account linking and local LLM management to ensure clarity and accuracy.
Prioritize bug fixes and improvements based on user feedback and activity levels, focusing on the most impactful issues first.
Monitor support channels for emerging trends and proactively address potential problems before they escalate.
Create a dedicated internal knowledge base to document common issues, workarounds, and solutions for faster support response times.
Implement a system for tracking and categorizing user feedback to identify recurring issues and prioritize development efforts.
Investigate the feasibility of providing alternative methods for downloading local LLMs, such as direct downloads or offline installation options.
Explore potential compatibility issues between Pieces OS, different operating systems, and specific hardware configurations.
Optimize the performance of local LLM downloads to minimize download times and improve user experience.
Provide users with more detailed information about the progress and status of local LLM downloads, including estimated completion times and potential errors.
Consider implementing a queuing system for local LLM downloads to manage multiple concurrent downloads and prevent conflicts.
Investigate the possibility of offering pre-configured virtual environments or containerized solutions to simplify local LLM setup and usage.
Develop a more comprehensive troubleshooting guide for common issues with the Pieces Desktop app, including step-by-step instructions and helpful tips.
Provide users with an easy way to report bugs and provide feedback directly within the Pieces Desktop app.
Regularly analyze support data to identify areas for improvement and track the effectiveness of implemented solutions.
Encourage users to participate in beta testing programs to gather early feedback and identify potential issues before public release.
